explains: v. （尤指用武力）镇压，压制；阻止（进程或活动）；封锁，隐瞒（消息）；抑制（生理过程）；克制（感情或反应），忍住；部分（或完全）消除（电干扰）；（心理分析）自觉抑制（不愉快的想法，记忆）
wordGroup: suppress inflation 遏止通货膨胀

sentences.en: He was prepared to suppress rebellion by shooting down protesters.
sentences.cn: 他准备枪杀抗议者来镇压叛乱。

sentences.en: Indeed, the war effort against Britain tended to suppress class conflicts.
sentences.cn: 实际上，针对英国的战争导致对阶级冲突的压制。

sentences.en: This then meant that the military had to remain to suppress rebellion and organize government.
sentences.cn: 这就意味着军队必须留下来镇压叛乱，组织政府。
